metadata.synopsis: At the onset of World War II, American Lt. Col. Robert Frederick (William Holden) is put in charge of a unit called the 1st Special Service Force, composed of elite Canadian commandos and undisciplined American soldiers. With Maj. Alan Crown (Cliff Robertson) leading the Canadians and Maj. Cliff Bricker (Vince Edwards) the acting head of the American contingent, there is initial tension -- but the team comes together when given a daunting mission that few would dare to attempt.

reviews: Only the stuntmen excel in this star-studded but inane war film filled with tiresome cliches.
There was doubtless stupidity on both sides during the war; there's certainly no lack of it in The Devil's Brigade.
